map.title: 2006 QuickBird satellite imagery orthomosaic [natural color]
map.decription: This map showcases 2006 satellite imagery of Pohnpei taken by Digital Globe’s QuickBird satellite. The data were purchased and processed by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS). The image shown here is in natural color. Image portions that fall outside the barrier reef of Pohnpei are omitted from the map.

map.title: Shoreline
map.decription: This map shows the shoreline and the land area of Pohnpei and smaller islands in Pohnpei's lagoon and on the barrier reef. It actually contains two datasets: the shoreline itself and Pohnpei base layer. Both were derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and the University of Guam (UOG) (2017) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The shoreline was slightly shifted and partly updated around Kolonia and its vicinity based on Worldview-3 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2016).

map.title: Shoreline
map.decription: This map shows the shoreline and the land area of Kosrae island, Lelu island, and smaller islands on the surrounding reef and in mangrove swamps. It actually contains two datasets: the shoreline itself and Kosrae base layer. Both were created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) based on Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) from U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps. The shoreline and base layer were shifted and adjusted to follow current imagery better. In urban areas, the shoreline was updated using Worldview-2 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2015-18) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Shoreline
map.decription: This map shows the shoreline and the land area of Yap and smaller islands in Yap's lagoon and on the barrier reef. It actually contains two datasets: the shoreline itself and Yap base layer. Both were created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) based on Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) from U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps. The shoreline and base layer were shifted and adjusted to follow current imagery better. In urban areas, the shoreline was updated using Worldview-3 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2016) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Shoreline
map.decription: This map shows the shoreline and the land area of all islands in Chuuk Lagoon and on the barrier reef. It actually contains two datasets: the shoreline itself  were created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020). The shoreline was manually digitized based on Worldview-2 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2014 and 2018-2019 for selected urban areas) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) while the reef areas were generally based on the Digital Line Graphs (DGLs) by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) but shifted and adjusted to follow current imagery better.

map.title: Shoreline and base layer
map.decription: This map shows the shoreline and the land area of all islands in Chuuk Lagoon and on the barrier reef. It actually contains two datasets: the shoreline itself and Chuuk base layer. Both were created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020). The shoreline was manually digitized based on Worldview-2 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2014 and 2018-2019 for selected urban areas) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) while the reef areas were generally based on the Digital Line Graphs (DGLs) by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) but shifted and adjusted to follow current imagery better. The base layer distinguishes high islands from low islands, lagoon reefs from lagoon bottom, and barrier reef flats from deeper and permanently submerged parts of the barrier reef.

map.title: 10-m elevation contours [grayscale]
map.decription: This map represents the topography of Pohnpei. It shows elevation contour lines at 10-meter intervals. Depicted in greyscale, the contour lines were derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and the University of Guam (UOG) (2017) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) created by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1975 and the shoreline dataset representing the zero contour line.

map.title: Shaded relief
map.decription: This map shows the relief of terrain on Pohnpei. The dataset was derived from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) created by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1975. The dataset was derived using the so-called hillshade function that creates an illusion of viewing terrain in 3D.

map.title: Shaded relief and elevation
map.decription: This map shows the elevation and relief of terrain on Pohnpei. It consists of two separate datasets, both of which were derived from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) created by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1975. The two datasets are a DEM classified into elevation intervals and colored and a hillshade layer that creates an illusion of viewing terrain in 3D. Combined, they produce hypsometric-tinted shaded relief seen on the map and give illusion of viewing terrain in 3D while also providing elevation information.

map.title: Benchmarks
map.decription: This map shows the location of benchmarks established on Pohnpei and the location of the continuously operating reference station (CORS). These data come from National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) - National Geodetic Survey (NGS) (2011 and 2012).

map.title: Benchmarks
map.decription: This map shows the location of survey control points established on the islands of Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by creating a subset of the Digital Line Graphs (DGLs) by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS). The dataset was shifted to follow current imagery better. The exact location in this dataset may not be accurate.

map.title: Unique landforms
map.decription: This map shows the most prominent and unique natural landforms, such as rock and reef formations and other geological sites of interest in Chuuk Lagoon. This layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) using field observations and location data from a variety of sources. The selection of included sites is not definitive and the layer will be appended with more fieldwork in the future.

map.title: USGS topographic map (2001)
map.decription: This is a topographic map of Pohnpei. It is made from a raster document actually comprised of four separate topographic maps, 1:25,000 scale, first published by the U.S. Geological Survey (2001) as paper documents. The maps were later scanned and georeferenced to create what is commonly referred to as Digital Raster Graphics (DRGs). In the map shown here, portions of the DRG that fall outside the barrier reef of Pohnpei are omitted.

map.title: USGS topographic map (2001)
map.decription: This is a topographic map of Kosrae. The topographic map, 1:25,000 scale, was first published by the U.S. Geological Survey (2001) as a paper document. The map was later scanned and georeferenced to create what is commonly referred to as Digital Raster Graphics (DRGs). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) converted the original PDF files to GeoTiffs. In the map shown here, portions of the DRG that fall outside the barrier reef of Kosrae are omitted.

map.title: USGS topographic map (1996)
map.decription: This is a topographic map of Yap. The topographic map, 1:25,000 scale, was first published by the U.S. Geological Survey (1996) as a paper document. The map was later scanned and georeferenced to create what is commonly referred to as Digital Raster Graphics (DRGs). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) converted the original PDF file to GeoTiff. In the map shown here, portions of the DRG that fall outside the barrier reef of Yap are omitted.

map.title: USGS topographic map (1996-1997)
map.decription: This is a topographic map of Chuuk. It is made from a raster document actually comprised of eight separate topographic maps, 1:25,000 scale, published by the U.S. Geological Survey (1996-1997) as paper document. The maps were later scanned and georeferenced to create what is commonly referred to as  Digital Raster Graphics (DRGs). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) converted the original PDF files to GeoTiffs. The scanned topographic maps are commonly referred to as Digital Raster Graphics (DRGs). In the map shown here, portions of the DRG that fall outside the barrier reef of Chuuk are omitted.

map.title: Basic soil types
map.decription: This map shows the basic soil types of Pohnpei. The original dataset was created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) (1982) as part of The soil survey of the Island of Ponape, Federated States of Micronesia at 1:10,000 scale. Soil map unit delineations were confirmed as accurate during a subsequent evaluation (1999). In addition to soil names and classification, the dataset contains information on terrain, erosion hazard, flooding hazard, and soil suitability for specific crops.

map.title: Basic soil types
map.decription: This map shows the basic soil types of Kosrae.  The original dataset was created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) (1983) as part of the soil survey of the Islands of Kosrae, Federated States of Micronesia at 1:10,000 scale. Soil map unit delineations were confirmed as accurate during a subsequent evaluation (1999). The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by extracting and formatting a subset of the Gridded Soil Survey Geographic (gSSURGO) Database for Federated States of Micronesia (2019) created by USDA-NRCS.

map.title: Basic soil types
map.decription: This map shows the basic soil types of Yap.  The source of this layer is the Gridded Soil Survey Geographic (gSSURGO) Database for Federated States of Micronesia (2016) created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS). The original dataset was created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) (1983) as part of the soil survey of the Islands of Yap, Federated States of Micronesia at 1:10,000 scale. Soil map unit delineations were confirmed as accurate during a subsequent evaluation (1999). The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by extracting and formatting a subset of the Gridded Soil Survey Geographic (gSSURGO) Database for Federated States of Micronesia (2019) created by USDA-NRCS.

map.title: Basic soil types
map.decription: This map shows the basic soil types of the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The original dataset was created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) (1983) as part of the soil survey of the Islands of Truk, Federated States of Micronesia at 1:10,000 scale. Soil map unit delineations were confirmed as accurate during a subsequent evaluation (1999). The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by extracting and formatting a subset of the Gridded Soil Survey Geographic (gSSURGO) Database for Federated States of Micronesia (2019) created by USDA-NRCS.

map.title: Erosion hazard
map.decription: This map represents levels of erosion hazard in different areas of Pohnpei. The data were created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) and set are included in the same dataset as the one used for the Basic soil types map. Erosion hazard in different areas is estimated based on the local soil type, terrain slope, and other parameters.

map.title: Erosion hazard
map.decription: This map represents levels of erosion hazard in different areas of Chuuk. The data were created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) and are included in the same dataset as the one used for the basic soil types map. Erosion hazard in different areas is estimated based on the local soil type, terrain slope, and other parameters.

map.title: Flooding hazard
map.decription: This map represents levels of erosion hazard in different areas of Pohnpei. The data were created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) and set are included in the same dataset as the one used for the basic soil types map. Flooding hazard in different areas is estimated based on the local soil type, drainage, and other parameters.

map.title: General land use
map.decription: This map shows the general land use zones of Pohnpei. The original data layer was created by the Pohnpei State Government. It was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to better match the most recent shoreline. This layer is not authoritative and may require substantial verification and revision by Pohnpei State Government.

map.title: General geology
map.decription: This map shows the general geology of Pohnpei. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by scanning, georeferencing, and digitizing a paper map prepared by the U.S. Geological Survey (1944) for the Chief of Engineers, U.S. Army as part of the Strategic Engineering Study No. 109 titled Ponape including Pakin and Ant Islands (Carolines) Terrain Intelligence. The map was found in the library collection at the national campus of the College of Micronesia (COM). It should be noted that this map is very general and erroneously identifies areas in Sokehs and Nett as being composed of raised reef rock.

map.title: General geology
map.decription: This map shows the general geology of Yap. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by scanning, georeferencing, and digitizing a paper map with data by C.G. Johnson, geologist, Military Geology Branch, US Geological Survey; prepared for the Intelligence Division, Office of the Engineer, Hq. US Army Japan; based on field investigations by C.G. Johnson in 1947-1948; compiled in 1956 from Caroline Islands 1:25,000, Series W856, Sheets 1850 III NW, 1850 IV NE, 1850 IV SE and 1850 IV SW; original mapping by photogrammetric (multiplex) methods 1954.

map.title: General geology
map.decription: This map shows the general geology of the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by scanning, georeferencing, and digitizing a set of paper maps prepared under the direction of the Engineer, Hq AFFE/8A, by the US Army Map Service, Far East; based on field investigations by the Military Geology Branch, Intelligence Division, Office of the Engineer, Hq, US Army Japan. Fieldwork conducted in 1954-1955 by JT Stark, RL Hay, HG May, and ED Patterson; maps are titled "Geology, Truk Islands" and were compiled in 1957 by photogrammetric (multiplex) methods.

map.title: Detailed geology
map.decription: This map shows the detailed geology of Pohnpei. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by scanning, georeferencing, and digitizing a paper map found in Spengler, S. R., Spencer, K. J., Mahoney, J. J., and Goles, G. G. (1994), Geology and Geochemical Evolution of Lavas on the Island of Pohnpei.

map.title: General physiography
map.decription: This map shows the general physiography of Pohnpei. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by scanning, georeferencing, and digitizing a highly general paper map prepared by the U.S. Geological Survey (1944) for the Chief of Engineers, U.S. Army as part of the Strategic Engineering Study No. 109 titled Ponape including Pakin and Ant Islands (Carolines) Terrain Intelligence. The map was found in the library collection at the national campus of the College of Micronesia (COM).

map.title: General physiography
map.decription: This map shows the general physiography of Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using a combination of 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) (USGS, 1967) and the simple soil map of Kosrae (NRCS, 1981), and applying them to the base layer (iREi, 2019).

map.title: General physiography
map.decription: This map shows the general physiography of the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by scanning, georeferencing, and digitizing a set of paper maps prepared under the direction of the Engineer, Hq AFFE/8A, by the US Army Map Service, Far East; based on interpretations for road and airfield constructions by Harold G. May, 1954-1955; maps are titled "Suitability for Road and Airfield Construction Map, Truk Islands" and were compiled in 1957 by photogrammetric (multiplex) methods.

map.title: Prominent peaks
map.decription: This map shows the locations of prominent peaks on Pohnpei. This data layer was developed by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by merging and slightly modifying data from U.S. Geological Survey's Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) and KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013). The place names shown on this map are copied from the two sources above and are not authoritative. They require thorough verification and correction of spellings to conform with Pohnpeian orthography.

map.title: Prominent peaks
map.decription: This map shows the locations of prominent peaks on Kosrae. This data layer was developed by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by merging and slightly modifying data from U.S. Geological Survey's Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) and shapefiles provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA). The place names shown on this map are copied from the two sources above and are not authoritative. They require thorough verification and correction of spellings to conform with Kosraean orthography.

map.title: Hilltops
map.decription: This map shows the locations of prominent peaks on Yap. This data layer was developed by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by slightly modifying data from U.S. Geological Survey's Geographic Names Information System (GNIS). The place names shown on this map are copied from the two sources above and are not authoritative. They require thorough verification and correction of spellings to conform with Yapese orthography.

map.title: Prominent peaks
map.decription: This map shows the locations of prominent peaks on the high islands in Chuuk Lagoon. This data layer was developed by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by extracting a subset of the U.S. Geological Survey's Geographic Names Information System (GNIS). Note that the actual names contained in the dataset are copied exactly as they are in GNIS and are not necessarily correct or aligned with Chuukese orthography.

map.title: Prominent caves
map.decription: This map shows the locations of prominent caves on Pohnpei. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013). It should be noted that Pohnpei has no karst terrain whatsoever, so caves found on the island are all in volcanic bedrock.

map.title: Prominent caves
map.decription: This map shows the locations of prominent caves on Kosrae. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from location information provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA). It should be noted that Kosrae has no karst terrain whatsoever, so caves found on the island are all in volcanic bedrock. The natural caves are lava tubes.

map.title: Prominent caves
map.decription: This map shows the locations of prominent caves on Chuuk. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by manually digitizing features from the topographic map of Chuuk, 1:25,000 scale, published by the U.S. Geological Survey (1996-1997). The locations are approximate and none were verified in the field. Along with the location, we noted the approximate directions of the caves' openings, as marked on the topographic maps. It should be noted that high islands of Chuuk Lagoon have no karst terrain, so all caves found there are in volcanic units. They include both natural caves (lava tubes and cliff-base rock shelters) and human-made caves (mostly excavated for defensive purposes by the Japanese military during World War II).

map.title: Extent of coral reefs
map.decription: This map shows the extent of coral reefs around Pohnpei. The data layer shown here is a subset of Pohnpei base layer derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The shoreline was slightly shifted and partly updated around Kolonia and its vicinity based on Worldview-3 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2016).

map.title: Extent of coral reefs
map.decription: This map shows the extent of coral reefs around Kosrae. The data layer shown here is a subset of Kosrae base layer derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The shoreline was partially updated and the coral reef features were slightly shifted and partially modified based on Worldview-2 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2015-2018) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Extent of coral reefs
map.decription: This map shows the extent of coral reefs around Yap. The data layer shown here is a subset of Yap base layer derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The shoreline was partially updated and the coral reef features were slightly shifted and partially modified  based on Worldview-3 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2016) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Extent of coral reefs
map.decription: This map shows the extent of coral reefs of Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer shown here is a subset of Chuuk base layer created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by manually digitizing of shorelines and from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (1996-1997). The shoreline was created in entirety and coral reef features were slightly shifted and partially modified based on Worldview-2 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2015-2016) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Reef geomorphology
map.decription: This map classifies the reefs around Pohnpei by their geomorphology. The dataset used here is the same as the one used for the reef zonation map. It was created by the Millennium Coral Reef Mapping Project by the Institute for Marine Remote Sensing - University of South Florida (IMaRS-USF) and the Institut de Recherche Pour le Développement (IRD) (2005). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) extracted this subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Reef geomorphology
map.decription: This map classifies the reefs around Kosrae by their geomorphology. The dataset used here was created by the Millennium Coral Reef Mapping Project by the Institute for Marine Remote Sensing - University of South Florida (IMaRS-USF) and the Institut de Recherche Pour le Développement (IRD) (2005). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Reef geomorphology
map.decription: This map represents the topography of Pohnpei. It shows elevation contour lines at 10-meter intervals. Depicted in greyscale, the contour lines were derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and the University of Guam (UOG) (2017) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) created by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1975 and the shoreline dataset representing the zero contour line.

map.title: Reef habitat types
map.decription: This map classifies the reefs around Yap by their geomorphology. The dataset used here is the same as the one used for the reef zonation map. It was created by the Millennium Coral Reef Mapping Project by the Institute for Marine Remote Sensing - University of South Florida (IMaRS-USF) and the Institut de Recherche Pour le Développement (IRD) (2005). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Reef geomorphology
map.decription: This map classifies the reefs of Chuuk Lagoon by their geomorphology. The dataset used here is the same as the one used for the reef zonation map. It was created by the Millennium Coral Reef Mapping Project by the Institute for Marine Remote Sensing - University of South Florida (IMaRS-USF) and the Institut de Recherche Pour le Développement (IRD) (2005). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Reef zonation
map.decription: This map classifies the reefs around Pohnpei by zone. Reef zones describe the locations and ecological conditions of different parts of the reef with respect to the reef system as a whole. The data set used here is the same as the one used for the reef geomorphology map.It was created by the Millennium Coral Reef Mapping Project by the Institute for Marine Remote Sensing - University of South Florida (IMaRS-USF) and the Institut de Recherche Pour le Développement (IRD) (2005).

map.title: Reef habitat types
map.decription: This map classifies the reefs of Chuuk Lagoon by zone. Reef zones describe the locations and ecological conditions of different parts of the reef with respect to the reef system as a whole. The dataset used here is the same as the one used for the reef geomorphology map. It was created by the Millennium Coral Reef Mapping Project by the Institute for Marine Remote Sensing - University of South Florida (IMaRS-USF) and the Institut de Recherche Pour le Développement (IRD) (2005). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Seagrass areas
map.decription: This map shows the extent and basic types of seagrass areas around Pohnpei. The data set classifies seagrass areas by one of the three main species (Cymodocea rotundata, Thalassia hemprichii, and Enhalus acaroides) and the level of coverage (describes as continuous, aggregated, and isolated). The data source is McKenzie, L.J. and Rasheed, M.J. (2006), Seagrasses: Pohnpei Island and And Atoll Marine Assessment, Technical report of survey conducted 26 October – 3 November 2005, Seagrass‐Watch HQ, DPI&F, Cairns, 60pp.

map.title: Passes in the barrier reef
map.decription: This map shows the locations of principal passes in the barrier reef around Pohnpei. This data layer was developed by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by merging and slightly modifying data from U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001), KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013), and identifying and including one one additional reef pass. The place names shown on this map are copied from the sources above and are not authoritative. They require thorough verification and correction of spellings to conform with Pohnpeian orthography.

map.title: Reef passes
map.decription: TThis map shows the locations of principal passes in the barrier reef around Kosrae. This data layer was derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by slightly modifying data from U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The place names shown on this map are copied from the source require thorough verification and correction of spellings to conform with Kosraean orthography.

map.title: Reef passes
map.decription: This map shows the locations of principal passes in the barrier reef around Yap. This data layer was derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by slightly modifying data from U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (1996). The place names shown on this map are copied from the source require thorough verification and correction of spellings to conform with Yapese orthography.

map.title: Passes and channels
map.decription: This map shows the locations of the passes in the barrier reef allowing entry of large vessels from open ocean into Chuuk Lagoon, as well as the most prominent reef and mangrove channels allowing transit and shore access by small boats and canoes. This data layer was derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) from data from Geographic Names Information System (GNIS), Geoview, and Student Atlas of Chuuk, published by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2018). We have updated many place names to reflect modern Chuukese orthography, but they are still subject to verification and correction if necessary.

map.title: Bathymetry
map.decription: This map shows the bathymetry (depth to seafloor) around Pohnpei. The dataset was extracted from the 2014 General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO). Known as the GEBCO_2014 Grid, this is a continuous terrain model for ocean and land with a spatial resolution of 30 arc seconds. It is an updated version of the GEBCO_08 Grid that was first published in January 2009. Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) extracted the dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Bathymetry
map.decription: This map shows the bathymetry (depth to seafloor) around Kosrae. It was generated by AutoGrid (2019), a web application that creates grids and map images from multibeam bathymetry data. AutoGrid is a program by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI, formerly NGDC). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Bathymetry
map.decription: This map shows the bathymetry (depth to seafloor) around Kosrae. It was generated by AutoGrid (2019), a web application that creates grids and map images from multibeam bathymetry data. AutoGrid is a program by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI, formerly NGDC). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Bathymetry
map.decription: This map shows the bathymetry (depth to seafloor) around Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was extracted from the 2020 General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO) by the GEBCO Compilation Group (2020) as part of the Seabed 2030 Project. Known as the GEBCO 2020 Grid, this is a continuous terrain model for ocean and land with a spatial resolution of 15 arc seconds. It is an updated version of previous GEBCO Grids, first published in January 2009. Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Bathymetry
map.decription: This map shows the bathymetry (depth to seafloor) around Yap. This map shows the bathymetry (depth to seafloor) around Yap. It was generated by AutoGrid (2019), a web application that creates grids and map images from multibeam bathymetry data. AutoGrid is a program by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI, formerly NGDC). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Bathymetry
map.decription: This map shows the bathymetry (depth to seafloor) around Yap. This map shows the bathymetry (depth to seafloor) around Yap. It was generated by AutoGrid (2019), a web application that creates grids and map images from multibeam bathymetry data. AutoGrid is a program by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI, formerly NGDC). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Bathymetry
map.decription: This map shows the bathymetry (depth to seafloor) around Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was extracted from the 2020 General Bathymetric Chart of the Oceans (GEBCO) by the GEBCO Compilation Group (2020) as part of the Seabed 2030 Project. Known as the GEBCO 2020 Grid, this is a continuous terrain model for ocean and land with a spatial resolution of 15 arc seconds. It is an updated version of previous GEBCO Grids, first published in January 2009. Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Popular surf breaks
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular surf breaks around Pohnpei. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013).

map.title: Popular surf breaks
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular surf breaks around Kosrae. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from information provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).

map.title: Popular dive sites
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular dive sites and dive paths around Pohnpei. The two data layers were formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013).

map.title: Popular dive sites
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular dive sites around Kosrae. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from information provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).

map.title: Popular dive sites
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular dive sites and dive paths around Yap. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by digitizing and merging several different tourist maps available from dive centers in Yap. Locations of the sites are highly approximate.

map.title: Popular dive sites
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular dive sites in Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by digitizing several tourist and historic maps depicting the sites of WWII wrecks in Chuuk Lagoon and cross-referencing them with exact location data reported by Jeffery (2007), war graves, munition dumps and pleasure grounds: A post- colonial perspective of Chuuk Lagoon’s submerged World War II sites; as well as Jeffery (2012), The future of Chuuk Lagoon's submerged WW II sites. All dive sites shown here are sunken ships, planes, and related war remains.

map.title: Popular snorkeling spots
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular snorkeling spots around Pohnpei. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013).

map.title: Popular swimming spots
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular swimming spots around Pohnpei. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013). Note that only saltwater spots are included on this map. Popular swimming spots along Pohnpei's many rivers are not shown.

map.title: Popular swimming spots
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular swimming spots around Kosrae. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from information provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).

map.title: Popular swim and picnic sites
map.decription: This map shows the locations of popular swimming spots and small-island beach and picnic sites in Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), using information provided as KML files by Nely Mori Ruben (Chuuk Visitors Bureau). Note that only the best known locations are included on this map. Many others are not shown.

map.title: Mooring buoys
map.decription: This map shows the locations of mooring buoys around Kosrae. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from information provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).

map.title: Streams and rivers [iREi version]
map.decription: This map shows the streams and rivers on Pohnpei. The dataset was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using line and polygon KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013) and modifying them to fit the most recent base layer. Note that these data show wide areas of rivers as polygons.

map.title: Streams and rivers [USGS version]
map.decription: This map shows the rivers and streams on Pohnpei as represented on the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The dataset was extracted from the Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) from USGS and names from the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) and slightly modified to match the (partially) updated shoreline.

map.title: Streams and rivers [USGS version]

map.title: Natural outflow points
map.decription: This map shows the natural outflow locations on Pohnpei, defined as points where streams and rivers discharge into the lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by identifying the points where streams and rivers from 1:25,000-scale U.S. Geological Survey topographic maps (2001) intersect with the most recent shoreline of Pohnpei.

map.title: Stream outflow points

map.title: Natural outflow points
map.decription: This map shows the natural outflow locations on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon, defined as points where streams and rivers discharge into the lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by identifying the points where streams and rivers from 1:25,000-scale U.S. Geological Survey topographic maps (1996-1997) intersect with the most recent shoreline of Chuuk. Please note that the points are somewhat arbitrary and approximate because many streams discharge into mangrove areas rather then directly into the lagoon and lack particular channels or single outflow locations.

map.title: Waterfalls
map.decription: This map shows the locations of the most significant waterfalls on Pohnpei. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013).

map.title: Waterfalls
map.decription: This map shows the locations of waterfalls on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), using field observations and information provided as KML files by Nely Mori Ruben (Chuuk Visitors Bureau).

map.title: Flow paths
map.decription: This map shows the theoretical drainage pattern on Pohnpei. The flow paths were created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and the University of Guam (2017). This was done by Maria Kottermair through hydrological modeling using a 10-meter Digital Elevation Model (DEM) created by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1975. Note that in very flat low-lying areas the data may indicate straight lines that are an artifact of the modeling process and do not reflect reality.

The higher the value, the more water a particular location receives from areas uphill. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and the University of Guam (2017). map.title: Principal watersheds
map.decription: This map shows the principal watersheds (drainage basins) on Pohnpei. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and the University of Guam (2017). Basin boundaries were delineated through hydrological modeling using a 10-meter Digital Elevation Model (DEM) created by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1975. Note that basin boundaries shown are modeled and, as such, reflect the DEM and not necessarily actual situation on the ground. The watershed boundaries may differ from actual management units, especially as smaller basins were sometimes merged to a ‘principal’ watershed to avoid too many small remnant basins.

map.title: General water resources
map.decription: This map shows the general distribution of freshwater resources on Pohnpei. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by scanning, georeferencing, and digitizing a very general paper map prepared by the U.S. Geological Survey (1944) for the Chief of Engineers, U.S. Army as part of the Strategic Engineering Study No. 109 titled Ponape including Pakin and Ant Islands (Carolines) Terrain Intelligence. The map was found in the library collection at the national campus of the College of Micronesia (COM).

The DLGs were created by U.S. Geological Survey for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001).

map.title: Weather stations

map.title: Average annual rainfall
map.decription: This map shows the average annual rainfall in inches on Pohnpei. The original data were derived from weather records from 1971-2000 by Chris Daly and Mike Halbleib of the PRISM Group at Oregon State University (2006) and the U.S. National Park Service (2006). It was later converted to vector format by the Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Average annual rainfall
map.decription: This map shows the average annual rainfall in inches on Kosrae. The original data were derived from weather records from 1971-2000 by Chris Daly and Mike Halbleib of the PRISM Group at Oregon State University (2006) and the U.S. National Park Service (2006). Data were converted to GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019).

map.title: Vegetation (1975)
map.decription: This map shows the vegetation of Pohnpei in 1975. It was derived by Landcare research from 1975 Vegetation Survey Maps of Pohnpei. The original hardcopy map was created as part of the following publication: MacLean, C.D., Cole, T.G., Whitesell, C.D., Falanruw, M.V., and Ambacher, A.H. (1986). Vegetation Survey of Pohnpei, Federated States of Micronesia. U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), Resource Bulletin PSW-18. It was also included in Newsome, P. F., M. J. Page, and H. A. Heke (2003), Vegetation Map of Pohnpei 1995, Federated States of Micronesia. Unpublished Contract Report LC0203/079, Landcare Research, New Zealand. The dataset was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to better match 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery.

map.title: Vegetation (1975)
map.decription: This map shows the vegetation of Yap in 1975. It was derived by Landcare research from 1975 Vegetation Survey Maps of Yap. The original hardcopy map was created as part of the following publication: MacLean, C.D., Cole, T.G., Whitesell, C.D., Falanruw, M.V., and Ambacher, A.H. (1986). Vegetation Survey of Yap, Federated States of Micronesia. U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), Resource Bulletin PSW-18. It was also included in Newsome, P. F., M. J. Page, and H. A. Heke (2003), Vegetation Map of Yap 1995, Federated States of Micronesia. Unpublished Contract Report LC0203/079, Landcare Research, New Zealand. The dataset was shifted modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to better match 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Vegetation (1995)
map.decription: This map shows the vegetation of Pohnpei in 1995. It was developed from 1:15,000 color stereo aerial photographs obtained in October 1995 by L. Cairns (Department of Survey and Land Information, New Zealand), interpreted by stereoscope by P. Newsome and M. Page, and validated by field inspection. It was also included in Newsome, P. F., M. J. Page, and H. A. Heke (2003), Vegetation Map of Pohnpei 1995, Federated States of Micronesia. Unpublished Contract Report LC0203/079, Landcare Research, New Zealand. The dataset was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to better match 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery.

map.title: Vegetation (2002)
map.decription: This map shows the vegetation of Pohnpei in 2002. The dataset was provided courtesy of The Nature Conservancy. The dataset was developed from color stereoscope interpretation of 1:15,000 aerial photographs obtained in May 2002 by L. Cairns, carried out by stereoscope by P. Newsome and M. Page, and validated by two weeks' field inspection. It was included in Newsome, P. F., M. J. Page, and H. A. Heke, (2003), Vegetation Map of Pohnpei 2002, Federated States of Micronesia. Unpublished Contract Report LC0203/079, Landcare Research, New Zealand. The dataset was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to better match 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery.

map.title: Vegetation (2005)
map.decription: This map shows the vegetation of Pohnpei in 2005. The dataset was developed from 2005 QuickBird satellite imagery by Digital Globe through land cover classification carried out by U.S. Forest Service (2007). The dataset was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to better match 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery.

map.title: Vegetation (2005)

map.title: Vegetation (2004-2006)

The dataset was formatted by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) for use in the Digital Atlas.

map.title: Wetlands

map.title: Municipalities [areas]
map.decription: This map shows the six municipalities of Pohnpei. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The data were modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to fit the most recent base layer. At the same time, iREi added the municipality of Kolonia, which was defined as the sum of Kolonia Town parcels recorded by Public Lands and digitized by Department of Land and Natural Resources ca. 2005. Those parcels were merged into one polygon and cut from Nett Municipality, of which Kolonia was a part of until 1965. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.

map.title: Municipalities [areas]
map.decription: This map shows the four municipalities of Kosrae. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The data were modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to fit the most recent base layer. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.

map.title: Municipalities [areas]
map.decription: This map shows the approximate extent of the ten municipalities of Yap. The GIS file was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (2020) by georeferencing and digitizing the map printed in Sunn, Low, Tom and Hara, Inc. (1971) Feasibility studies for the installation of communal water facilities in the populated areas of Tomil, Gagil and Kanifay, Honolulu, Hawaii, 24 p., and slightly modifying it based on village locations shown in the USGS topographic map and village municipal affiliations listed in the Yapese-English dictionary. Note that the sources used are not authoritative and the boundaries shown are highly approximate and in no way definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.

map.title: Municipalities [areas]
map.decription: This map shows the municipalities in Chuuk Lagoon. The layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) from the most recent base layer. Islands were classified into municipalities as per information in the Chuuk State Constitution. Only the main islands were classified, and all low-lying islands were left undefined due to uncertain status or lack of information. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.

map.title: Wehi [areas]
map.decription: This map shows the five wehi of Pohnpei. Wehi are Pohnpei's traditional kingdoms. Wehi correspond to modern municipalities. The only exception is Kolonia, which is not a wehi but became a municipality in 1965 when it was separated from Nett. The original data layer, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), was created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). It was modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to fit the most recent base layer. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.

map.title: Municipalities pre-1980s [areas]
map.decription: This map shows the four municipalities of Kosrae plus the fifth municipality, Walung, before it was merged with Tafunsak in the 1980s. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The data were modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to fit the most recent base layer. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.

map.title: Regions and sub-regions
map.decription: This map shows the principal regions and sub-regions in Chuuk Lagoon. The layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) from the most recent base layer. Islands were grouped into regions commonly used by Chuuk State government and further into culturally-established sub-regions. Only the main islands were classified. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.

map.title: Capitals

map.title: Capitals
map.decription: This map shows the locations of Tofol, the state capital of the Kosrae State, and Lelu, the island's main traditional center and historic capital. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019).

map.title: Capitals
map.decription: This map shows the locations of Colonia, the state capital of Yap State, and the three highest ranking villages in the context of traditional authority. The three villages are Ngolog, Teab, and Gachpar. They are of equal rank and are collectively known as Dalip Pi Nguchol. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019).

map.title: Capitals
map.decription: This map shows the locations of the Chuuk State capital Weno, the historic capital Tonoas, and the capital villages of the individual municipalities in Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) from information contributed by informants from different municipalities.

map.title: Kolonia land parcels
map.decription: This map shows the land parcels of Kolonia town. This geospatial dataset was created by Department of Land and Natural Resources (ca. 2005) by digitizing parcels recorded by Public Lands.

map.title: Place names
map.decription: This map shows the locations of all named geographic features on Pohnpei that are contained within the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS). The GNIS is the official database that contains all standard toponyms in the U.S. and its territories and associated states. It was developed by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) in cooperation with the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN) in order to standardize place names. Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) transferred this information to GIS format and shifted to match the most recent base layer and 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery. Note that the actual names contained in the dataset are copied exactly as they are in GNIS and are not necessarily correct or aligned with Pohnpeian orthography.

map.title: Population by age and sex
map.decription: This map shows the number of residents of Pohnpei by municipality, and also provides information on sex and age distribution in the form of population pyramids for each municipality. The attribute tables in the actual dataset also contain information on median age and average annual population growth rate. This geospatial dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).

map.title: Roads
map.decription: This map shows the road network on Pohnpei. It includes major roads as well as smaller paved and unpaved roads. The dataset was originally created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) (2001) for Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) used to show information on 1:25,000-scale topographic maps. It has been modified to reflect changes and add street names of selected roads throughout the years and using various sources including Kolonia Town Government, U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS), and Pohnpei State Government - Department of Land and Natural Resources (2013). A major update was performed by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to reflect changes based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe. The attribute information (name and type of road) has not been updated recently.

map.title: Roads
map.decription: This map shows the road network on Kosrae. It includes major roads as well as smaller paved and unpaved roads. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on a dataset by KIRMA and major adjustments made by John Paul Batarao (2019) to match 2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Roads
map.decription: This map shows the road network on Yap. It includes major roads as well as smaller paved and unpaved roads. The dataset was created by Maria Kottermair (iREi) (2019) based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS). The attribute information (name and type of road) is based on visual interpretation of imagery and has not been verified in the field.

map.title: Roads
map.decription: This map shows the road network on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. It only includes major roads. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), by extracting data from the Open Street Map (2020) and formatting it for use in this atlas.

map.title: Bridges and causeways
map.decription: This map shows major bridges and causeways on Pohnpei. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.

map.title: Bridges and causeways
map.decription: This map shows major bridges and causeways on Kosrae. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019), based on 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Bridges and causeways
map.decription: This map shows major bridges and causeways on Yap. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Bridges and causeways
map.decription: This map shows major bridges and causeways on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), based on 2016 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Hiking trails
map.decription: This map shows hiking trails on Pohnpei. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013) and Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) created by U.S. Geological Survey for 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001).

map.title: Recreational sites
map.decription: This map shows recreational sites on Kosrae: prominent hiking locations, playfields, picnic sites, and others. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019), using KML files created specifically for this Digital Atlas by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019), as well as latitude-longitude coordinates provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).

map.title: Docks, piers, marinas, anchorages
map.decription: This map shows the most significant docks, piers, marinas, and anchorages in Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by interpreting 2016 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) and compiling locations from a variety of sources, notably Geoview.

map.title: Port and airport locations
map.decription: This map shows the locations of the international port and airport on Pohnpei. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.

map.title: Port and airport locations
map.decription: This map shows the locations of dock, marina, port, and airport facilities on Kosrae. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019), based on 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) and from KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Port and airport locations
map.decription: This map shows the locations of the international port and airport on Yap. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: International port and airport locations
map.decription: This map shows the locations of the international port and airport in Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), based on 2016 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Port and airport zones
map.decription: This map shows the international port and airport zones on Pohnpei. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by extracting polygons from zoning information provided by Pohnpei State Government and verifying them based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe. The dataset also includes the outline of the runway. The boundaries are not authoritative.

map.title: Port and airport zones
map.decription: This map shows the international port and airport zones on Kosrae. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS). The dataset also includes the outline of the runway. The boundaries are not authoritative.

map.title: Port and airport zones
map.decription: This map shows the international port and airport zones on Yap. The dataset also includes the outline of the runway. The boundaries are not authoritative.

map.title: International port and airport zones
map.decription: This map shows the international port and airport zones in Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by outlining polygons based on 2016 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS). The dataset also includes the outline of the runway. The boundaries are not authoritative.

map.title: Locations of houses and other buildings
map.decription: This map shows the locations of houses and other buildings, mostly residential, but also including other uses. The dataset was created by FSM Telecom (2017) and formatted for this atlas by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017).

map.title: Locations of houses and other buildings
map.decription: This map shows the locations of all houses, buildings, and other human-made structures. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by converting building footprints of houses and other buildings to point features. The buildings footprints were based on 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Locations of houses and other buildings
map.decription: This map shows the locations of all houses, buildings, and other human-made structures. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by converting building footprints of houses and other buildings to point features. The buildings footprints were based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Locations of houses and other buildings
map.decription: This map shows the footprints of key government offices (state, national, foreign) and other major buildings on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by manually digitizing all structures visible in 2014 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) and then converting the polygons into central points.

map.title: Footprints of houses and other buildings
map.decription: This map shows the footprints of all houses, buildings, and other human-made structures. The shapefile was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by manually digitizing polygons from 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Footprints of houses and other buildings
map.decription: This map shows the footprints of all houses, buildings, and other human-made structures. The dataset is a combination from Open Street Map data (2019) and data created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019). More than half the building footprints were manually digitized by iREi based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS). Footprints extracted from OSM data may be based on older imagery and explain a ‘shift’ that might be seen in some areas.

map.title: Footprints of houses and other buildings
map.decription: This map shows the footprints of key government offices (state, national, foreign) and other major buildings on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) by manually digitizing all structures visible in 2014 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).

map.title: Major businesses
map.decription: This map shows the locations of businesses on Pohnpei. The information was extracted by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001).

map.title: Major businesses
map.decription: This map shows the locations of businesses on Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Key government offices and major buildings in Kolonia and Palikir areas
map.decription: This map shows the footprints of key government offices (state, national, foreign) and other major buildings. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on field verification and 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.

map.title: Government offices
map.decription: This map shows office locations of key government entities (state, national, foreign). The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on field verification and 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.

map.title: Government offices
map.decription: This map shows the locations of key government offices (national, state, municipal, and Lelu town), as well as non-governmental organizations in Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Government offices
map.decription: This map shows the locations of key government offices (national, state, and local), as well as non-governmental organizations in Yap. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on various sources including Open Street Map and Google Maps, as well as local informants, namely Joshua Libyan Tun and Larry Raigetal, who corrected and added information specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Public sector
map.decription: This map shows the footprints of key government offices (state, national, foreign) and other major quasi-governmental and non-governmental entities on the islands of Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), based on the listing in the FSM Telecom Phonebook 2020 and field verification of office locations.

map.title: Major businesses
map.decription: This map shows the locations of businesses on Yap. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on various sources including Open Street Map and Google Maps, as well as local informants, namely Joshua Libyan Tun and Larry Raigetal, who corrected and added information specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Major businesses
map.decription: This map shows office locations of major business entities on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), based on various sources including Open Street Maps and Google Maps and limited field verification.

map.title: Hospitals and clinics
map.decription: This map shows the locations of hospitals, clinics, and dispensaries on Pohnpei. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014) and further improved (with additional points added) by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. Additional features were added.

map.title: Hospitals and clinics
map.decription: This map shows the locations of the hospital and community health centers on Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on information from Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) and KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Hospitals and clinics
map.decription: This map shows the locations of the hospital and community health centers on Yap. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019), using KML files created by by the Wa'ab Community Health Center/ Yap Department of Health Services (2019).

map.title: Hospitals and clinics
map.decription: This map shows the locations of hospitals, clinics, and dispensaries on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), based on field verification. Attribute information for the hospital is from the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013).

map.title: Schools
map.decription: This map shows the locations of schools and colleges on Pohnpei. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014) and further improved (with additional points added) by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. Additional features were added based on information provided the Pohnpei State Government (2017).

map.title: Schools
map.decription: This map shows the locations of schools and colleges on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The dataset was updated based on KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Schools
map.decription: This map shows the locations of schools and colleges on Yap. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) from KML files created by Joshua Libyan Tun specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Schools
map.decription: This map shows the locations of schools and colleges on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The data were developed by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), based on the list of public schools provided by Chuuk State Department of Education, list of private schools, and field verification of their locations.

map.title: Churches
map.decription: This map shows the locations of churches on Pohnpei. The information was extracted by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001).

map.title: Places of worship
map.decription: This map shows the locations of churches and one mosque on Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Places of worship
map.decription: This map shows the locations of churches on Yap. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on various sources including Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013), as well as local informants, namely Joshua Libyan Tun and Larry Raigetal, who corrected and added information specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Places of worship
map.decription: This map shows the locations of churches on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), based on various sources, notably Geoview.

map.title: Fire stations

The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were reviewed for accuracy and currentness.

map.title: Police stations
map.decription: This map shows the locations of police stations on Pohnpei. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014) and further improved (with additional points added) by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were reviewed for accuracy and currentness.

The dataset was updated based on KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Communication infrastructure
map.decription: This map shows the communication infrastructure on Pohnpei. The features shown include communication towers, wifi access points, and cell sites. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The dataset was updated by Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) and Island Research & Education Initiative (2017) based on information provided by FSM Telecommunications Corporation.

map.title: Communication infrastructure
map.decription: This map shows the communication infrastructure on Kosrae. The features shown include communication towers, wifi access points, and cell sites. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The dataset was updated by Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) and Island Research & Education Initiative (2017) based on information provided by FSM Telecommunications Corporation, and by Island Research & Education Initiative (2019) using KML files created specifically for this Atlas by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019).

map.title: Communication infrastructure
map.decription: This map shows the communication infrastructure on Yap. The features shown include communication towers, wifi access points, and cell sites. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by combining data developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013), as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program, and from KML files created by Joshua Libyan Tun specifically for this Digital Atlas.

map.title: Communication infrastructure
map.decription: This map shows the communication infrastructure on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. This map shows the locations of features shown include communication towers, wifi access points, and cell sites on the islands in Chuuk Lagoon. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020), based on field verification and previously available data from the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC), created as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program.

map.title: Waste disposal
map.decription: This map shows the location of the landfill on Pohnpei. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.

map.title: Waste disposal
map.decription: This map shows the location of the landfills on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were updated using feedback from Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA), which distinguished between the formal landfill and the closed sites.
